Posts.Content: Apr 3, 2008 05:04PM Kellyd0613 wrote: Janis, I agree with the others...in that area it's likely to be a hernia.  I'm also glad to hear that others have lumps and bumps besides me.  I noticed one in my upper arm after surgery 3 years ago and pressed/played with it almost everyday, (to see if it changed) I just recently asked the doctor about it.  He said nothing to worry about.......I hate that I hadn't asked sooner, all that time wasted worrying. Kelly
Posts.Title: Well, f-it I call the surgeon. Fitztwins Fitzy

Posts.Content: Nov 9, 2009 08:55PM Kellyd0613 wrote: Luah, Yes, that's what they figured, plus this way no risk of lymphadema.   They also decided against radiation (can't really remember why) , but i think it was the fact that the invasive areas were small. Kelly
Posts.Title: Stage II w/Lymph Node Involvement Warrior517 Moderators

Posts.Content: Nov 9, 2009 08:09PM Kellyd0613 wrote: Luah I was diagnosed with stage IIA in early 2005.  Originally diagnosed as DCIS, during mastectomy they found four invasive areas, (1mm-4mm) and 1mm in the sentinel node.  My breast surgeon presented my case to her tumor board, and their decision was no further lymph nodes needed to be removed since chemo was now a necessity.  I had dose dense ACT then Herception now Tamoxifen.
